verses.kjv: After these things Jesus went over the sea of Galilee, which is the sea of Tiberias.
verses.ct: After this, Jesus crossed to the other side of the Sea of Galilee, also called the Sea of Tiberias.

verses.kjv: And a great multitude followed him, because they saw his miracles which he did on them that were diseased.
verses.ct: A huge crowd kept following him because they had witnessed the miraculous signs he performed on people who were sick.

verses.kjv: And Jesus went up into a mountain, and there he sat with his disciples.
verses.ct: Jesus went up on a hillside and sat down there with his disciples.

verses.kjv: And the passover, a feast of the Jews, was nigh.
verses.ct: The Passover, the Jewish festival, was near.

verses.kjv: When Jesus then lifted up his eyes, and saw a great company come unto him, he saith unto Philip, Whence shall we buy bread, that these may eat?
verses.ct: When Jesus looked up and noticed a massive crowd approaching him, he said to Philip, "Where can we purchase enough food for all these people to eat?"

verses.kjv: And this he said to prove him: for he himself knew what he would do.
verses.ct: He asked this to test Philip, because he already knew what he was going to do.

verses.kjv: Philip answered him, Two hundred pennyworth of bread is not sufficient for them, that every one of them may take a little.
verses.ct: Philip replied, "Even 200 denarii worth of bread wouldn't be enough for each person to get even a small piece."

verses.kjv: One of his disciples, Andrew, Simon Peter’s brother, saith unto him,
verses.ct: One of his disciples, Andrew, who was Simon Peter's brother, spoke up:

verses.kjv: There is a lad here, which hath five barley loaves, and two small fishes: but what are they among so many?
verses.ct: "There's a boy here who has 5 barley loaves and 2 small fish — but what good is that for such a large crowd?"

verses.kjv: And Jesus said, Make the men sit down. Now there was much grass in the place. So the men sat down, in number about five thousand.
verses.ct: Jesus said, "Have everyone sit down." There was plenty of grass in that area, so the men sat down — about 5,000 of them.

verses.kjv: And Jesus took the loaves; and when he had given thanks, he distributed to the disciples, and the disciples to them that were set down; and likewise of the fishes as much as they would.
verses.ct: Then Jesus took the loaves, gave thanks, and distributed them to those who were seated. He did the same with the fish, giving everyone as much as they wanted.

verses.kjv: When they were filled, he said unto his disciples, Gather up the fragments that remain, that nothing be lost.
verses.ct: Once everyone had eaten their fill, he told his disciples, "Collect all the leftover pieces so that nothing goes to waste."

verses.kjv: Therefore they gathered them together, and filled twelve baskets with the fragments of the five barley loaves, which remained over and above unto them that had eaten.
verses.ct: So they collected them and filled 12 baskets with the pieces left over from the 5 barley loaves — more than the people could eat.

verses.kjv: Then those men, when they had seen the miracle that Jesus did, said, This is of a truth that prophet that should come into the world.
verses.ct: When the people saw the miraculous sign Jesus had performed, they said, "This truly is the Prophet who was supposed to come into the world."

verses.kjv: When Jesus therefore perceived that they would come and take him by force, to make him a king, he departed again into a mountain himself alone.
verses.ct: Jesus realized they were about to come and seize him to make him king by force, so he withdrew to the mountain by himself, completely alone.

verses.kjv: And when even was now come, his disciples went down unto the sea,
verses.ct: When evening came, his disciples went down to the lake.

verses.kjv: And entered into a ship, and went over the sea toward Capernaum. And it was now dark, and Jesus was not come to them.
verses.ct: They got into a boat and started crossing toward Capernaum. By now it was dark, and Jesus still hadn't joined them.

verses.kjv: And the sea arose by reason of a great wind that blew.
verses.ct: A strong wind was blowing, and the water was getting rough.

verses.kjv: So when they had rowed about five and twenty or thirty furlongs, they see Jesus walking on the sea, and drawing nigh unto the ship: and they were afraid.
verses.ct: After they had rowed about 3 or 4 miles, they saw Jesus walking on the water, coming closer to the boat, and they were terrified.

verses.kjv: But he saith unto them, It is I; be not afraid.
verses.ct: But he called out to them, "It's me — don't be afraid."

verses.kjv: Then they willingly received him into the ship: and immediately the ship was at the land whither they went.
verses.ct: They were glad to take him into the boat, and right away the boat reached the shore where they were heading.

verses.kjv: The day following, when the people which stood on the other side of the sea saw that there was none other boat there, save that one whereinto his disciples were entered, and that Jesus went not with his disciples into the boat, but that his disciples were gone away alone;
verses.ct: The next day, the crowd that had stayed on the opposite shore realized that only one boat had been there, and that Jesus had not gotten into it with his disciples — they had left without him.

verses.kjv: (Howbeit there came other boats from Tiberias nigh unto the place where they did eat bread, after that the Lord had given thanks:)
verses.ct: (However, other boats from Tiberias had landed near the spot where the Lord had given thanks and the people had eaten the bread.)

verses.kjv: When the people therefore saw that Jesus was not there, neither his disciples, they also took shipping, and came to Capernaum, seeking for Jesus.
verses.ct: So when the crowd saw that neither Jesus nor his disciples were there, they got into those boats and went to Capernaum to look for Jesus.

verses.kjv: And when they had found him on the other side of the sea, they said unto him, Rabbi, when camest thou hither?
verses.ct: When they found him on the other side of the lake, they asked him, "Rabbi, when did you get here?"

verses.kjv: Jesus answered them and said, Verily, verily, I say unto you, Ye seek me, not because ye saw the miracles, but because ye did eat of the loaves, and were filled.
verses.ct: Jesus answered them, "I tell you the truth: you're looking for me not because you witnessed miraculous signs, but because you ate the bread and had your fill."

verses.kjv: Labour not for the meat which perisheth, but for that meat which endureth unto everlasting life, which the Son of man shall give unto you: for him hath God the Father sealed.
verses.ct: "Don't work for food that spoils. Instead, work for food that lasts into eternal life, which the Son of Man will give you. God the Father has placed his seal of approval on him."

verses.kjv: Then said they unto him, What shall we do, that we might work the works of God?
verses.ct: They asked him, "What must we do to carry out the works God requires?"

verses.kjv: Jesus answered and said unto them, This is the work of God, that ye believe on him whom he hath sent.
verses.ct: Jesus answered, "The work God requires is this: put your trust in the one he has sent."

verses.kjv: They said therefore unto him, What sign shewest thou then, that we may see, and believe thee? what dost thou work?
verses.ct: So they pressed him, "What miraculous sign will you perform so we can see it and believe you? What will you do?"

verses.kjv: Our fathers did eat manna in the desert; as it is written, He gave them bread from heaven to eat.
verses.ct: "Our ancestors ate manna in the wilderness. As the Scripture says, 'He gave them bread from heaven to eat.'"

verses.kjv: Then Jesus said unto them, Verily, verily, I say unto you, Moses gave you not that bread from heaven; but my Father giveth you the true bread from heaven.
verses.ct: Jesus told them, "I tell you the truth: it wasn't Moses who gave you that bread from heaven. It is my Father who gives you the true bread from heaven."

verses.kjv: For the bread of God is he which cometh down from heaven, and giveth life unto the world.
verses.ct: "Because the bread of God is the one who comes down from heaven and gives life to the world."

verses.kjv: Then said they unto him, Lord, evermore give us this bread.
verses.ct: They said to him, "Lord, always give us this bread!"

verses.kjv: And Jesus said unto them, I am the bread of life: he that cometh to me shall never hunger; and he that believeth on me shall never thirst.
verses.ct: Jesus declared, "I am the bread of life. Whoever comes to me will never go hungry, and whoever believes in me will never be thirsty."

verses.kjv: But I said unto you, That ye also have seen me, and believe not.
verses.ct: "But as I told you, you have seen me and still you don't believe."

verses.kjv: All that the Father giveth me shall come to me; and him that cometh to me I will in no wise cast out.
verses.ct: "Everyone the Father gives to me will come to me, and I will absolutely never turn away anyone who comes to me."

verses.kjv: For I came down from heaven, not to do mine own will, but the will of him that sent me.
verses.ct: "Because I came down from heaven not to carry out my own will, but the will of the one who sent me."

verses.kjv: And this is the Father’s will which hath sent me, that of all which he hath given me I should lose nothing, but should raise it up again at the last day.
verses.ct: "And this is the will of the one who sent me: that I should not lose a single one of all those he has given me, but raise them up on the last day."

verses.kjv: And this is the will of him that sent me, that every one which seeth the Son, and believeth on him, may have everlasting life: and I will raise him up at the last day.
verses.ct: "This is what the one who sent me wants: that everyone who sees the Son and believes in him will have everlasting life, and I will raise them up on the last day."

verses.kjv: The Jews then murmured at him, because he said, I am the bread which came down from heaven.
verses.ct: The Jewish leaders began grumbling about him because he said, "I am the bread that came down from heaven."

verses.kjv: And they said, Is not this Jesus, the son of Joseph, whose father and mother we know? how is it then that he saith, I came down from heaven?
verses.ct: They said, "Isn't this Jesus, Joseph's son? We know his father and mother. How can he claim, 'I came down from heaven'?"

verses.kjv: Jesus therefore answered and said unto them, Murmur not among yourselves.
verses.ct: Jesus responded, "Stop grumbling among yourselves."

verses.kjv: No man can come to me, except the Father which hath sent me draw him: and I will raise him up at the last day.
verses.ct: "No one can come to me unless the Father who sent me draws them, and I will raise that person up on the last day."

verses.kjv: It is written in the prophets, And they shall be all taught of God. Every man therefore that hath heard, and hath learned of the Father, cometh unto me.
verses.ct: "It is written in the Prophets: 'They will all be taught by God.' Everyone who has listened to the Father and learned from him comes to me."

verses.kjv: Not that any man hath seen the Father, save he which is of God, he hath seen the Father.
verses.ct: "Not that anyone has actually seen the Father — only the one who is from God has seen the Father."

verses.kjv: Verily, verily, I say unto you, He that believeth on me hath everlasting life.
verses.ct: "I tell you the truth: whoever believes has everlasting life."

verses.kjv: I am that bread of life.
verses.ct: "I am the bread of life."

verses.kjv: Your fathers did eat manna in the wilderness, and are dead.
verses.ct: "Your ancestors ate manna in the wilderness, and they still died."

verses.kjv: This is the bread which cometh down from heaven, that a man may eat thereof, and not die.
verses.ct: "But this is the bread that comes down from heaven, so that a person may eat it and not die."

verses.kjv: I am the living bread which came down from heaven: if any man eat of this bread, he shall live for ever: and the bread that I will give is my flesh, which I will give for the life of the world.
verses.ct: "I am the living bread that came down from heaven. If anyone eats this bread, they will live forever. The bread I will give is my flesh, which I will give for the life of the world."

verses.kjv: The Jews therefore strove among themselves, saying, How can this man give us his flesh to eat?
verses.ct: The Jewish leaders argued intensely with each other, saying, "How can this man give us his flesh to eat?"

verses.kjv: Then Jesus said unto them, Verily, verily, I say unto you, Except ye eat the flesh of the Son of man, and drink his blood, ye have no life in you.
verses.ct: Jesus told them, "I tell you the truth: unless you eat the flesh of the Son of Man and drink his blood, you have no life in you."

verses.kjv: Whoso eateth my flesh, and drinketh my blood, hath eternal life; and I will raise him up at the last day.
verses.ct: "Whoever eats my flesh and drinks my blood has eternal life, and I will raise them up on the last day."

verses.kjv: For my flesh is meat indeed, and my blood is drink indeed.
verses.ct: "My flesh is true food, and my blood is true drink."

verses.kjv: He that eateth my flesh, and drinketh my blood, dwelleth in me, and I in him.
verses.ct: "Whoever eats my flesh and drinks my blood remains in me, and I remain in them."

verses.kjv: As the living Father hath sent me, and I live by the Father: so he that eateth me, even he shall live by me.
verses.ct: "Just as the living Father sent me and I live because of the Father, so the one who feeds on me will live because of me."

verses.kjv: This is that bread which came down from heaven: not as your fathers did eat manna, and are dead: he that eateth of this bread shall live for ever.
verses.ct: "This is the bread that came down from heaven — not like what your ancestors ate. They ate manna and still died, but whoever eats this bread will live forever."

verses.kjv: These things said he in the synagogue, as he taught in Capernaum.
verses.ct: He said all of this while teaching in the synagogue in Capernaum.

verses.kjv: Many therefore of his disciples, when they had heard this, said, This is an hard saying; who can hear it?
verses.ct: After hearing this, many of his disciples said, "This teaching is extremely difficult. Who can accept it?"

verses.kjv: When Jesus knew in himself that his disciples murmured at it, he said unto them, Doth this offend you?
verses.ct: Jesus, aware that his disciples were grumbling about this, said to them, "Does this upset you?"

verses.kjv: What and if ye shall see the Son of man ascend up where he was before?
verses.ct: "What if you were to see the Son of Man going back up to where he was before?"

verses.kjv: It is the spirit that quickeneth; the flesh profiteth nothing: the words that I speak unto you, they are spirit, and they are life.
verses.ct: "The Spirit is the one who gives life; human effort accomplishes nothing. The words I have spoken to you are spirit and life."

verses.kjv: But there are some of you that believe not. For Jesus knew from the beginning who they were that believed not, and who should betray him.
verses.ct: "Yet some of you don't believe." Jesus had known from the very beginning which ones would not believe and who would betray him.

verses.kjv: And he said, Therefore said I unto you, that no man can come unto me, except it were given unto him of my Father.
verses.ct: Then he said, "That is why I told you that no one can come to me unless the Father makes it possible."

verses.kjv: From that time many of his disciples went back, and walked no more with him.
verses.ct: From that point on, many of his disciples turned away and stopped following him.

verses.kjv: Then said Jesus unto the twelve, Will ye also go away?
verses.ct: So Jesus asked the 12, "Are you going to leave too?"

verses.kjv: Then Simon Peter answered him, Lord, to whom shall we go? thou hast the words of eternal life.
verses.ct: Simon Peter answered him, "Lord, who else would we go to? You have the words of eternal life."

verses.kjv: And we believe and are sure that thou art that Christ, the Son of the living God.
verses.ct: "We have come to believe and are convinced that you are the Christ, the Son of the living God."

verses.kjv: Jesus answered them, Have not I chosen you twelve, and one of you is a devil?
verses.ct: Jesus replied, "Didn't I choose all 12 of you? Yet one of you is a devil."

verses.kjv: He spake of Judas Iscariot the son of Simon: for he it was that should betray him, being one of the twelve.
verses.ct: He was talking about Judas Iscariot, the son of Simon, because Judas — though one of the 12 — was the one who would eventually betray him.
